creator: adir@conflictx.dyndns.org
text:
Yo, I didnt used any log-rotation facility under my Debian server, When 
apache's errer.log got greater then 2.5G it freezed and stopped to servre, When 
I tried to restart it, it failed, and there was no sign of any error on the 
logs, I found it by running apache with -F argument via the command line (and i 
got File Lime Excided with no sign on which file it talks about). well it can 
be a possible DoS.

Bless you all!

It's obviously a bug in the underlying system. You'd probably find a lot of such
reports in this bug tracker. Fix your system and use log rotation. What should
apache do, if it can't open log files? We've decided, that it's not a good idea
to do anything, because it may be bad.
